title: Fürstenland
text:
Fürstenland or Alte Landschaft is the name of a historical territory of the Swiss <a href="canton%20of%20St.%20Gallen">canton of St. Gallen</a>, corresponding to the modern districts of <a href="St.%20Gallen%20%28Wahlkreis%29">St. Gallen</a> (without the city proper), <a href="Wil%20%28Wahlkreis%29">Wil</a> and <a href="Rorschach%20%28Wahlkreis%29">Rorschach</a>.
It was a subject territory of the <a href="Abbey%20of%20St.%20Gallen">Abbey of St. Gallen</a> until 1798.
Its population, known as the "Gotteshausleute", came into conflict with the Abbey after the <a href="Swiss%20Reformation">Swiss Reformation</a>, during 1525–1531.
After the defeat of Zürich in the <a href="Second%20War%20of%20Kappel">Second War of Kappel</a>, the Fürstenland was forced to return to Catholicism.
After the <a href="French%20Revolution">French Revolution</a>, the territory was granted increased autonomy in a treaty of 1795, and in 1797 additionally its own seal and the right to elect a local parliament.
On 14 February 1798, it constituted itself as a "Free Republic" ("Freie Republik der Landschaft St. Gallen"), which was absorbed into the <a href="Canton%20of%20S%C3%A4ntis">Canton of Säntis</a> three months later.
